main event: Multiple sightings of a bright, disc-shaped object were reported over Dover AFB, Delaware on 9th March 1953, with the object remaining stationary for an extended period before departing rapidly.
interesting points: The object was observed to change color from bright to reddish to yellowish, and was reported to make fast and erratic maneuvers with rapid acceleration and deceleration.
Radar tracking estimated the object's speed to vary from 12,000 to 15,000 mph, and its horizontal distance covered was estimated to be 50 miles.
A similar object was sighted later on the same day, remaining stationary and then fading out from view without any definite speed or direction of movement.
An experienced pilot and a school teacher were among the observers, and an A/T pilot requested permission to intercept the object but was refused.
The sightings occurred during clear weather conditions with a visibility of 20 miles, and there was no known physical evidence or metro activity related to the sightings.
witnesses: Multiple Air Force personnel including an experienced pilot and a school teacher
